name: Sachse Muslim Society
mission: Sachse Muslim Society (SMS) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that was established in 2014. We are dedicated to religious education and community service. SMS serves Sachse, Wylie, Rowlett, North Garland, Rockwall, and Murphy communities.
theoryOfChange: By providing structured Quranic education and a physical masjid space, the organization aims to revive hearts and nurture the spiritual and intellectual growth of the next generation of Muslims.
zakatClaimEvidence: Found 'zakat al-fitr' on https://sachsemasjid.org/ (https://sachsemasjid.org/); Website mission/programs mention zakat (Source: https://sachsemasjid.org/donate/)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: fi_sabilillah (+5); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 25/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish a time-bound plan to deploy excess unrestricted reserves into mission delivery, while keeping a clear operating reserve floor.
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.

risks.risk_summary: Key concern: Program expense ratio critically low: 14%

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Sachse Muslim Society shows moderate alignment and moderate impact, with zakat compliance (significant risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Found 'zakat al-fitr' on https://sachsemasjid.org/ (https://sachsemasjid.org/); Website mission/programs mention zakat (Source: https://sachsemasjid.org/donate/)

all_citations.claim: The organization operates the Sachse Quran Academy (SQA) and offers Full Time and Part Time Hifdh programs.
The organization provides various donation options for community support.
The organization engages the community through volunteer opportunities, particularly during Ramadan.
The organization reported total revenue of $2,799,757 and was founded in 2014.
Financial metrics include a 13.6% program expense ratio, 63.0 months of working capital, and fundraising efficiency of $0.11 per $1 raised.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization shows exceptional financial liquidity and fundraising efficiency, though its overall score is tempered by a low program expense ratio and moderate data transparency.
areas_for_improvement: Low program expense ratio of 13.6% relative to total revenue
Limited public documentation regarding specific impact metrics and program outcomes

dimension_explanations.alignment: The charity is Zakat-eligible and demonstrates high alignment for Muslim donors seeking to support local masjid infrastructure and Quranic literacy [2]. Its long-standing presence since 2014 and active volunteer engagement during Ramadan reflect a strong community track record [3][4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization provides direct religious services and education, including Hifdh programs [1]. While it maintains a very high level of working capital at 63.0 months, the program expense ratio is currently 13.6%, suggesting a significant portion of its $2,799,757 revenue is held in reserve rather than immediate program outlays [4][5].

baseline_narrative.headline: founded in 2014, the Sachse Muslim Society serves the religious and educational needs of the Sachse community through dedicated Quranic programs and local service initiatives.
strengths: High financial stability with 63.0 months of working capital
Strong fundraising efficiency of $0.11 per $1 raised
Direct provision of religious education through the Sachse Quran Academy
baseline_narrative.summary: The Sachse Muslim Society is a religious organization dedicated to providing religious education and community service in Sachse and its surrounding areas [1][4]. The organization operates the Sachse Quran Academy, which offers specialized programs including a Full Time Hifdh and a Part Time Hifz Program [1].

all_citations.quote: dedicated exclusively to religeous education and community service

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization shows exceptional financial liquidity and fundraising efficiency, though its overall score is tempered by a low program expense ratio and moderate data transparency.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization currently directs <cite id="6">13.6%</cite> of its expenses to programs, which is significantly below the <cite id="9">89.8% peer median</cite>.
While financial stability is a strength, holding <cite id="7">63.0 months of working capital</cite> suggests funds could be deployed more actively toward mission delivery.

bbb_assessment.summary: BBB assessment data is not available for this organization.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization is in a phase of rapid growth, which may explain the current accumulation of assets and lower proportional program spending.
risk_factors: <cite id="7">63.0 months of working capital</cite> indicating underutilized funds
case_against.summary: The primary concern for donors is the organization's low program expense ratio of <cite id="6">13.6%</cite>, which falls well below the <cite id="9">89.8% peer median</cite>.

data_gaps: Not fully rated by Charity Navigator
confidence.notes: Data confidence is moderate due to lack of transparency and independent audits.

alignment.explanation: The alignment score of 25/50 reflects a strong fit for Muslim donors, as the organization is <cite id="10">ZAKAT-ELIGIBLE</cite> and operates within the religious cultural cause area.
alignment.improvement: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this charity due to its established presence since <cite id="1">2014</cite> and direct provision of services like the <cite id="3">Full Time Hifdh</cite> program.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the charity could publish audited financial statements and detailed annual impact reports.

impact.explanation: The impact score of 24/50 is heavily impacted by the low program expense ratio of <cite id="6">13.6%</cite> and excessive reserves of <cite id="7">63.0 months of working capital</cite>.
impact.improvement: Publish a time-bound plan to deploy excess unrestricted reserves into mission delivery, while keeping a clear operating reserve floor.

rich_narrative.headline: founded in 2014, the Sachse Muslim Society serves the religious and educational needs of the Sachse community through dedicated Quranic programs and local service initiatives.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for local Texas donors who want to support the development of a growing masjid and its dedicated Quranic education programs.
donor_motivations: Want to support local Islamic infrastructure in the Sachse area
Value dedicated Hifz and Nadirah programs for youth
Prefer to give to organizations with strong financial reserves
giving_considerations: The organization currently spends a lower percentage of its budget on direct programs compared to peers
Significant funds are held in reserve rather than deployed immediately
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking high immediate program efficiency or international humanitarian relief.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C means some outcome measurement exists but lacks rigorous independent evaluation.

impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence helps ensure donations create real impact in the community.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With 63.0 months of working capital, the organization has substantial reserves and may not urgently need additional unrestricted funding for immediate operations.

strengths.detail: The organization maintains <cite id="7">63.0 months of working capital</cite>, ensuring long-term operational security.
The charity is highly efficient in its development efforts, spending only <cite id="8">$0.11 per $1 raised</cite>.
Through the Sachse Quran Academy, the organization directly provides a <cite id="3">Full Time Hifdh</cite> program to the local community.

strengths_deep_dive: The Sachse Muslim Society has shown remarkable financial growth, achieving a 3-year revenue CAGR of <cite id="5">290.8%</cite>. This rapid expansion has allowed the organization to build substantial reserves, currently holding <cite id="7">63.0 months of working capital</cite>. Their fundraising operations are highly efficient, requiring only <cite id="8">$0.11 per $1 raised</cite>, which maximizes the impact of incoming donations.
rich_narrative.summary: The Sachse Muslim Society, <cite id="1">founded in 2014</cite>, is dedicated to providing <cite id="2">religious education and community service</cite> in Sachse, Texas and surrounding areas. The organization operates the Sachse Quran Academy, offering specialized programs such as a <cite id="3">Full Time Hifdh</cite> and Part Time Hifz Program. Financially, the organization reported <cite id="4">$2,799,757</cite> in total revenue for 2023, demonstrating significant growth with a 3-year revenue CAGR of <cite id="5">290.8%</cite>. However, its program expense ratio sits at <cite id="6">13.6%</cite>, which is notably lower than industry standards. The charity maintains high financial stability with <cite id="7">63.0 months of working capital</cite> and demonstrates strong fundraising efficiency, spending just <cite id="8">$0.11 per $1 raised</cite>.
